edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie
Class Dot

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.isr.impromptu.pie.Dot
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener
public class Dot
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.w3c.dom.events.EventListener

A dot, for a file. Adapted from Ben Pillet's code. Its coordinate is described by both a relative radius and relative dot. The radius tells how far the dot is relative to the center of the pie. A 0 is at the center, a value less than 1 is within the pie (and shared), and a value larger than 1 is within the private space (thus not shared). Such a relative radius allows different peers have different dimensions. The angle tells where within the slice the dot lies. So when peers join and leave the dot can remain in a "stable" position. These properties are also stored in the repository for future use.

Author:
Jie Ren

setLocation

public void setLocation(double radius,
                        double angle,
                        int peers,
                        int cardinal)
Set the location of this dot, with relative coordiante This is supposed to be used to add files from other peers. The radius and angle are all relative values.

Parameters:
radius - the relative radius. 0 is the center, less than 1 is within the pie, larger than 1 is private
angle - the relative angle among the slice between 0 and 1
peers - the number of present peers
cardinal - the relative position of this peer

setLocation

public void setLocation(java.awt.Point p,
                        int peers,
                        int cardinal)
Set the location of this dot, with absolute coordiante This is used to support dropping a file by a local peer.

Parameters:
p - the x,y coordinate
peers - the number of present peers
cardinal - the relative position of this peer

updateLocation

public void updateLocation(java.awt.Point p)
Update the coordinate of the dot with an absolute coordiante Should be called after a setLocaion method

Parameters:
p - the new absolute point

updateLocation

public void updateLocation(double radius,
                           double angle)
Update the coordinate of the dot with relative coordiante Should be called after a setLocaion method

Parameters:
radius - the new relative radius
angle - the new relative angle

                           int cardinal)
